{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the clinical features seen in Zika fever, we need to analyze the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [1] states that the most common symptoms/signs of Zika fever include rash, conjunctivitis, fever, and headache. Document [5] also mentions that the most common signs and symptoms of Zika fever are fever, rash, conjunctivitis, muscle and joint pain, and headache. Document [6] describes the clinical manifestations of 10 cases of imported Zika virus disease, which include fever, cutaneous maculopapular rash, and congestive conjunctivitis. Document [13] states that the symptoms of Zika fever include fever, red eyes, joint pain, headache, and a maculopapular rash. Based on this information, it can be concluded that the clinical features seen in Zika fever include fever, rash, conjunctivitis, and joint pain. However, there is no mention of Guillain-Barre syndrome or petechial rash in any of the documents. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Petechial rash.", "answer_choice": "D"}
